intro: Silene pseudonurensis, commonly known as the narrowleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, which helps reduce water loss. Silene pseudonurensis is often found in meadows and along mountain slopes, where it thrives in full sun.
